text: I can prevent a parent template from showing up in a child theme by creating a template with the same name + structure but different content right?
and then updating `isAvailableForNewContent: false`
(this does not appear to work)
Updating the label will instantly update the template, but it looks like `isAvailableForNewContent` is not considered. Bug?
Is there another way that works? empty folder? empty file?
any insight would be much appreciated (I made the mistake of scheduling a 9:55am meeting to show off child themes)

CMS Improvement: Show what child theme (or otherwise) a page is using under the SETTINGS tab.

I just submitted this idea to HubSpot's idea forum.  I'd love your upvote.
<https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/HubSpot-Ideas/Indicator-of-what-CHILD-THEME-a-page-is-using/idi-p/506364#M94319>

also much agree, upvoted

Reusable sections from the parent theme are not available in child themes (page editor).
Hey Radu - this is a known bug, hoping to have a fix for this out by the end of the day today!
:+1: Thanks Mitchell

Hey everyone, I have an issue I'm trying to solve. We built a new theme for a client. A couple templates we built with dnd areas a couple we built without. He is trying to change the template on an existing page from one with no dnd (but has preset modules in it) to one with dnd, but none of the dnd templates show up as an option when trying to change the template. I have found several articles about flexible column templates not being able to switch to dnd templates but we didn't use flex columns. Is it still just an issue switching from no dnd to dnd?
this is not possible yet.. you cant switch from flex columns to DND.. you have to rebuild the page.
That's what I'm saying, we didn't use flex columns. It was just a hard coded template with html and modules added via the hubl
Is it still affected the same way as it would with a flex column?
so you are witching from a template that uses hubdb to a template that doesnt?
i see.. i reread it 3 times.. lol
lol sry for not explaining it clearly
hmm. interesting. so you are trying to add a dnd option into the main template.
that is being used for dynamic pages?

Just trying to change the template on an already existing page. The current template has no dnd or flex columns. Just hard coded html and hubl. When I try to change the template, none of my templates with dnd areas show as an option to switch.
This is the code in the current template:
for some reason it wont let me switch the template on an existing page that contains ^^^ to a template that is only dnd area.
it doesnt have the meta info in it

```<!--
  templateType: page
  isAvailableForNewContent: true
  enableDomainStylesheets: false
  label: Label Here
-->```
